definition: Application Programming Interface - a set of rules that allows programs to communicate with each other
Cascading Style Sheets - a language used to describe the presentation of a document written in HTML
Domain Name System - a system that translates human-readable domain names to IP addresses
Hypertext Transfer Protocol - the foundation protocol for data exchange on the web
JavaScript Object Notation - a lightweight data interchange format used for transmitting data
The core component of an operating system that manages operations of the computer and hardware
The time delay between the cause and the effect of some physical change in a system
Software that acts as a bridge between an operating system and applications running on it
A database approach designed for storing, retrieving and managing non-relational data
Object-Oriented Programming - a programming paradigm based on the concept of objects
A high-level, interpreted programming language known for its readability and simplicity
Representational State Transfer - an architectural style for designing networked applications
Structured Query Language - a standard language for storing, manipulating and retrieving data in databases
Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol - communication protocols used in computer networks
User Interface - the space where interactions between humans and machines occur
Virtual Machine - an emulation of a computer system that provides the functionality of a physical computer
Extensible Markup Language - a markup language that defines rules for encoding documents
YAML Ain't Markup Language - a human-readable data serialization standard
Content Delivery Network - a system of distributed servers that deliver web content to users based on geographic location
Create, Read, Update, Delete - four basic operations of persistent storage
